title: Utah Gov. signs laws requiring parental consent for minors to use social media
description: Utah's Gov. signed sweeping social media regulation into law that requires social media companies to get parental consent for minors using their services.

title: Plagued by drought, California is now soaked after 12 monstrous storms
description: After three years of drought, California is getting battered by atmospheric rivers, tornados and snowstorms, damaging homes and killing dozens.

title: Federal officials want to repeal a law that delayed warnings about dangerous products
description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission chair wants Congress to repeal Section 6(b), allowing the agency to warn the public more quickly about dangerous products

title: Norway watches warily as Russian subs and aircraft step up Arctic patrols
description: Norway releases video to NBC News showing Russian submarines off its coast, as it beefs up naval patrols to protect undersea pipeline and telecoms cables.

title: McCarthy says he would support a TikTok ban
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., told reporters he would support possible legislation to ban TikTok. He discussed the "bipartisan concern" shown at a hearing with the social media company's CEO.

title: Frustrated Dish customers still spending hours on hold weeks after ransomware attack, they say
description: A month after a ransomware attack on Dish Network, many customers say they are still having technical issues — and face wait times of up to 15 hours when they call to ask for assistance.

title: TikTok CEO discusses efforts to combat Spanish-language misinformation
description: TikTok CEO Shou Chew was questioned by Rep. Raul Ruiz, D-Calif., about what his company has done to combat and moderate misinformation targeting Spanish-speaking users on the platform.

title: Abrupt closure of ketamine clinic chain blindsides veterans with severe depression and chronic pain
description: Military veterans across the country are scrambling after more than a dozen clinics that had been providing them with free ketamine treatments suddenly closed.

title: Drug overdose deaths among Latinos have nearly tripled in the past decade
description: The number of opioid overdose deaths among Latinos have risen steeply, with experts citing the rise in fentanyl mixed with other drugs as the main reason.

title: TikTok CEO discusses efforts to address 'dangerous misinformation'
description: TikTok CEO Shou Chew was questioned by Rep. Diana DeGette, D-Colo., about his company's efforts to address the spread of misinformation on social media during a House hearing.

title: Live updates: Manhattan DA defends Trump probe, says House GOP request for info is an overreach
description: Live updates: Manhattan DA defends Trump probe, says House GOP request for info is an overreach

title: TikTok CEO describes 'Project Texas' plan to store U.S. data 'on American soil'
description: TikTok CEO Shou Chew told lawmakers of the company's plan for "Project Texas" that he assured would store and protect American user data on U.S. soil.

title: Click to cancel: FTC proposes rule to help consumers ditch subscriptions
description: A new rule proposed by the Federal Trade Commission on Thursday would make it easier for consumers to cancel recurring subscriptions.

title: Manhattan DA's Office blasts House Republicans' request for testimony about Trump probe
description: The Manhattan DA's Office on Thursday slammed three House Republican chairmen and argued they overstepped in their request for DA Alvin Bragg's testimony.

title: The woman behind viral TikTok videos about her husband's infidelity says she's not lying for clout
description: After TikTok user Rachael Buck posted a video showing the aftermath of her husband's apparent infidelity, it blew up — in popularity and in her face.

title: TikTok CEO testifies at House hearing as lawmakers consider banning the app
description: Watch live coverage as TikTok CEO Shou Chew testifies at a House Committee on Energy and Commerce hearing on protecting American data privacy.

title: Live updates: TikTok CEO testifies to Congress as scrutiny mounts on the Chinese-owned app
description: Live updates: TikTok testifies to Congress as scrutiny mounts on the Chinese-owned app

title: FTC wants to make it easier to cancel subscriptions, free trials
description: It can feel like there are subscription services for nearly everything these days — but it’s not always easy to cancel the plans once you begin. Now, the FTC is proposing a new rule to help consumers. NBC’s Vicky Nguyen reports for TODAY.

title: China criticizes possible U.S. plan to force TikTok sale
description: China’s government said Thursday it would oppose possible U.S. plans to force TikTok’s Chinese owner to sell the short-video service.

title: Arizona court declines most of Kari Lake’s appeal over gov’s race
description: The Arizona Supreme Court declined to hear most of Republican Kari Lake’s appeal in a challenge of her defeat in the governor’s race, but revived one claim.

title: TikTok CEO to testify before Congress amid calls to ban the app
description: The battle over TikTok is taking center stage in Washington as the company’s CEO Shou Zi Chew faces lawmakers amid a push by some to ban the app over its ties to China. NBC’s Savannah Sellers reports for TODAY.

title: Far-right 'Groyper' Riley Williams set to be sentenced for storming Capitol on Jan. 6
description: Riley Williams, an extremist "obsessed" with white nationalist Nick Fuentes, is set to be sentenced for storming the U.S. Capitol and entering Nancy Pelosi's office.

title: TikTok CEO to appear before Congress as lawmakers push to ban app
description: TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew is set to appear before Congress to defend his company amid data security concerns over the Chinese-owned social media app. NBC News’ Julie Tsirkin and Executive Director of the National Security Institute, Jamil Jaffer, break down why lawmakers are concerned about safety on TikTok and what to expect from Chew's testimony.

title: Off-duty pilot on Southwest flight helps land plane after captain falls ill
description: A pilot from another airline helped land a Southwest Airlines flight on Wednesday after its captain became "incapacitated" and required medical attention, forcing the flight to turn back to Las Vegas, according to the airline and radio traffic data.

title: China's drive for a new global order leaves Putin in the back seat
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping’s Russia visit was the latest step in Beijing’s bid to challenge the U.S. but also showcased how the war in Ukraine has made Putin a junior partner to Beijing.

title: What's to fear about warming oceans? Flesh-eating bacteria
description: Potentially deadly infections from a type of flesh-eating bacteria could significantly increase in the decades ahead as a result of climate change.

title: Why Biden's not talking about Trump’s potential indictment
description: No blueprint exists for what a sitting president should do when a predecessor is charged with a crime, and aides see possible risks and rewards.

title: U.S. rejects Chinese claim that warship was driven away after illegally entering part of the South China Sea
description: The United States has rejected Chinese claims that a U.S. warship was driven out of waters it illegally entered in the disputed South China Sea on Thursday.

title: 5 deaths reported in California storms; rare tornado near Los Angeles tears off roofs
description: A rare tornado touched down in a Los Angeles suburb on Wednesday, ripping roofs off a line of commercial buildings and sending the debris twisting into the sky and across a city block, injuring one person.

title: World's first 3D-printed rocket launches but fails to reach orbit in key test flight
description: The world’s first 3D-printed rocket made it off the launch pad but failed to reach orbit in a key test flight by aerospace startup Relativity Space.

title: TikTok's most popular House lawmaker says security concerns are real, but opposes ban
description: A TikTok famous North Carolina lawmaker says he recognizes "real" security concerns tied to the Chinese-owned video app but opposes an outright ban.

title: The tech watchdog that raised alarms about social media is warning about AI
description: One of tech's most vocal watchdogs has a warning about the explosion of advanced artificial intelligence: We need to slow down.
